thread.title: Man seriously assaulted in Haumoana dies
thread.title_full: Man seriously assaulted in Haumoana dies

title: Man seriously assaulted in Haumoana dies
text:
Man seriously assaulted in Haumoana dies Last updated 11:04, February 7 2017 FAIRFAX NZ 
A man has been seriously assaulted in Hawke's Bay. 
Police have launched a homicide investigation following the death of a man who was found unconscious in the small seaside settlement of Haumoana, Hawke's Bay, on Monday morning. 
Police believe the man was assaulted before being found unconscious at about 7am on Waitangi Day. 
He was admitted to Hawke's Bay Hospital in a critical condition and police said on Tuesday morning he had died. 
A scene examination in the area of Domain Rd has been carried out and police said they wanted to hear from anyone who may have seen the man in and around Grange Road North and Domain Road on the afternoon or evening of Sunday. 
READ MORE: * Man seriously assaulted in Haumoana 
â€‹ Police said the victim was a 45-year-old local man, with long scraggly hair. When found he was wearing a long sleeved red top and dark blue shorts. 
Anyone with information relevant to the incident is asked to call Hastings Police on 06 873 0500. Alternatively information can be shared anonymously via Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111.
